intro: Beketowia tian-shanica, commonly known as the Tian Shan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly the Tian Shan range. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and sturdy. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
